title: How to increase my grammatical knowledge in English - Quora

response.answer_text: English is my second language and now I am a English for ESL (English as a second Language) teacher for foreign students. I also teach Spanish. When I started learning the language I carried a dictionary everywhere I went. The store, the bus, the class, the groceries. The main secret is to accumulate as much vocabulary as you can and learn how to use it. When I was learning English 30 years ago we didn't have Google and all the current technology! I recommend my students to listen to the News on the language you are trying to learn because they will be the same News in 2 languages. Learn the way is used in sentences. Use English subtitles for movies. Write down the words you don't understand and ask a teacher or look it up in an online dictionary like Webster Definition of DICTIONARY In regards to grammar, unless you are writing papers in English, I wouldn't worry so much about the grammar but maybe just the basic verbs tenses (Present, Past, Future) this will give you enough to keep a conversation. This website has helped my students many times when teaching the right tense on verbs. Conjugation sing | Conjugate verb sing | Reverso Conjugator English Read, read, and memorize vocabulary, soon you will be surprise how much you understand.

Read some good books and more importantly practice. First of all you, need to achieve the basic knowledge of english grammar. Then practice will polish your grammatical skill. Read some books of renowned writer. Also you can take help from english newspaper. That will help you in sentence making and enrich your vocabulary.
